page.title: 06HOUSING IN MOUNTAIN ASH
page.content: The majority of homes within the Cynon Valley were built during the nineteenth century.The houses are constructed in long staight lines {(terraced homes)}along the sides of the valley.They were built very hurriedly to provide homes for the mineworkers and their families. The walls of the houses are made mostly of solid sandstone blocks (taken from local quarries)with some brick,and roofs made of slate imported from North Wales. The natural light colour of the stone,has become dark brown or black due to industrial soot and grime and the Valley has a very drab look to it especially on a wet day.However now that nearly all the industry has gone some people have had the walls of their homes cleaned by 'sand blasting'showing the nice colour of the natural stone again.
